sen.j: 薩戒記（さっかいき）は権大納言兼弾正尹中山定親の日記。
sen.e: Sakkai ki is a diary written by Sadachika NAKAYAMA, Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) and Danjoin (President of the Board of Censors).

sen.j: 1418年（応永25年）から1448年（嘉吉3年）までの記載がある。
完全に存在するのは、1425年-1426年（応永32・33年）のみであるが、古くから目録・抜書・部類記などの形での引用が多くなされたことがあり、途中の7年分を除けばその内容の多くが把握できる。
sen.e: Only the records written between 1425 and 1426 are extant in a perfect condition, but most of the diary has been quoted in catalogues, excerpts, and buruiki (categorized collection of court events and practices), so its contents are mostly known except the records written during the seven years in the middle.

sen.j: 定親は有職故実に詳しく後小松院から重用され、武家伝奏も務めた。
sen.e: It is regarded as an important historical material written in the mid-Muromachi period because Sadachika being familiar with Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette), taken into Gokomatsuin's confidence, working as buke tenso (liaison officers between the imperial court and the military government), he knew well the movement of both the Imperial court and Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
